data.title: Rolo Tomassi announce final album of trilogy and share "Drip"—watch
data.meta_description: Rolo Tomassi have announced their new album, along with the release of the single “Drip.” The album, Where Myth Becomes Memory, is set for release Feb. 4 and will feature “Drip” as well as the previously released “Cloaked,” which was the band’s first music since 2018. Read more: 20 mathcore albums that made the genre [&hellip;]
data.text:
Rolo Tomassi have announced their new album, along with the release of the single “Drip.”

The album, Where Myth Becomes Memory, is set for release Feb. 4 and will feature “Drip” as well as the previously released “Cloaked,” which was the band’s first music since 2018.

Read more: 20 mathcore albums that made the genre what it is

Rolo Tomassi also shared a cinematic video for “Drip.” Utilizing artistic double-exposed imagery, the video juxtaposes visuals of a beach, a forest and a field onto shots of the band members.

The group announced the new single and its visual on Instagram, saying, “More new music is coming.”

Read more: Top 20 hardcore bands with deeply inspirational lyrics

Where Myth Becomes Memory will serve as the final offering of a musical trilogy from the group, which started with 2015’s Grievances and 2018’s Time Will Die And Love Will Bury It.

“This is a really important album for all of us,” James Spence says. “Of anything we’ve done, it’s the one I’m most proud of. I think it’s the most ambitious and creative that our band has ever sounded and something that we’ve all needed to get through the last few years. We can’t wait to share it and to have you help us bring it to life.”

Read more: Top 50 metal songs from the past 20 years

Where Myth Becomes Memory is out Feb. 4., and you can preorder it here.

You can check out the visual for “Drip” below, and let us know your thoughts in the comments.

Where Myth Becomes Memory tracklisting:

1. “Almost Always”

2. “Cloaked”

3. “Mutual Ruin”

4. “Labyrinthine”

5. “Closer”

6. “Drip”

7. “Prescience”

8. “Stumbling”

9. “To Resist Forgetting”

10. “The End Of Eternity”

Rolo Tomassi tour dates:
